Subject: Cantera with Simulink?

X-Yahoo-Profile: brooksmoses1

Our research group has recently been trying to integrate Cantera 
calculations into some Matlab Simulink models, and it looks like it's 
a somewhat difficult process to get the two of them to work together 
in such a way as to be able to pass around mixture objects via 
Simulink links.

As I understand it, the primary problem appears to be that Simulink 
wants to only handle numbers and arrays of numbers; it doesn't (as
far as we can find) have a capacity to pass objects.  I expect the 
solution would be some form of creating a Cantera mixture object
(i.e. "heavyweight" reaction-mechanism object, as per earlier 
discussion of copying objects to track multiple states), extracting 
the pointer to this object in a form that Simulink can treat as a 
number, combining it with the numerical state information to make a 
"plain" vector representation that Simulink can pass around, and then 
reconstructing the relevant mixture objects from this within each 
Simulink block.  This seems like a rather complicated wheel to 
reinvent if someone's already done it, though, particularly if there 
are complications to it that I haven't forseen!

So: Has anyone on the list done this (or something similar) already, 
and if so can you offer some advice and perhaps examples of how to 
make this work?  Does the potential solution that I have seem like 
it's on the right track, and are there any nonobvious pitfalls I 
should look out for?

Thanks much,
- Brooks
